page.title: 08THE VILLAGE OF SNELLAND
page.content:
Snelland is an isolated rural community of about 70 inhabitants. There are 27 dwellings including some modern bungalows and 6 council houses. There are almost no amenities-just a telephone box and a letter box. There is no public house, club, school, village hall or playing field.
The village is visited by mobile shops including butcher, baker, milkman (4 days a week) and library van (every two weeks). National and local newspapers are delivered daily.
The postman uses a van and not only delivers letters and parcels but also takes letters and will cash giro cheques at Langworth Post Office if asked to do so by householders who cannot make other arrangements.
